0.title: HOSPITALS

1.title: OSCAR, OSCAR
clues: Hilary Swank won in 2000 for pretending to be a boy; this actress won for the same thing the year before

They're the 2 actresses named Hunt who've won acting Oscars

3.title: AUDIO LITERATURE
clues: He's the Monty Python member heard here reading from Dante's "Inferno"
He's the singer reading here from "The Eye of the Prophet" by Kahlil Gibran
It's the last name shared by the musician who wrote the book heard here & of his son who's reading it["I can see men of all colors bouncing along in the boxcar..."]

Made into a movie starring Leo DiCaprio, the "diaries" heard here are read by this man who wrote them["Today was my first City League game & my first day in any organized basketball league..."]

6.title: U.S. PRESIDENTS
clues: Some politicians made fun of this president's fussiness by referring to him as "Granny Hayes"

In 1905 he celebrated St. Patrick's Day by marrying one of his distant cousins
DAILY DOUBLE

A member of the Warren Commission, he co-wrote "Portrait of the Assassin", a book about Lee Harvey Oswald

8.title: SPACE SCIENTISTS
clues: In the 18th century Charles Messier was known as "The Ferret" of these tailed bodies

Willy Ley brought this man into the German Rocket Society, but unlike him wouldn't work with the Nazis
